intro: Colocynthis ecirrhosus, commonly known as the narrow-ribbed bitter apple, is a member of the Cucurbitaceae family. It is a shrub-like plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of the Middle East and North Africa. The plant produces yellow or orange fruits that are covered in a thick, waxy coating. Its leaves are alternate, palmately lobed, and often have a pubescent surface. The plant is characterized by its spiny stems and is adapted to survive in harsh, drought-prone environments.
